metadata.title: CVE-2009-0166 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The JBIG2 decoder in Xpdf 3.02pl2 and earlier, CUPS 1.3.9 and earlier, andother products allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash)via a crafted PDF file that triggers a free of uninitialized memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-0166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-2
No subscription required

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler111 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
poppler package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.5-1ubuntu2').
